image.alt: Hansen Orthodontics & Aesthetics office interior with team and smiling patients

paragraphs.text: At Hansen Orthodontics & Aesthetics, we’re more than just a dental practice. We’re a team of passionate professionals committed to crafting confident smiles that change lives. As a family-centered practice, we design personalized treatment plans that align with your lifestyle and long-term oral health. From braces for teens to aesthetic solutions for adults, we tailor every detail to you and focus on comfort, trust, and precision through the entire treatment journey.

items.title: Personalized Care
items.text: Individualized treatment plans that follow you from the first consultation through retention, focused on your goals and lifestyle.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: CBCT imaging, intraoral digital scanning, and 3D printing for more accurate, comfortable, and efficient diagnosis and appliance fabrication.

items.title: Family-Centered
items.text: Warm, relationship-focused care for children, teens, and adults in a practice built around comfort and community.

items.title: Five‑Star Outcomes
items.text: High patient satisfaction shown in written testimonials and video stories that highlight real results and care.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Nathan Hansen, DDS, MDS (Orthodontist), blends science, art, and heart into each smile. Born in El Paso, he trained at Creighton University (DDS) and completed an orthodontic residency at Saint Louis University (MS in Dental Science). He has pursued advanced mentorships and master classes in smile aesthetics and airway-focused treatments to deliver precise, patient-centered care.

image.alt: Dr. Nathan Hansen, orthodontist at Hansen Orthodontics & Aesthetics

paragraphs.text: We provide modern orthodontic care for teens and adults, from clear aligners to airway-focused treatments and custom retention plans.

image.alt: Spark clear aligners on tray, Hansen Orthodontics
Damon self-ligating braces in treatment, Hansen Orthodontics
Custom orthodontic retainers, Hansen Orthodontics
Airway orthodontics concept image

testimonials.author: Paulina Longenbaugh
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Hansen is an amazing doctor. I really appreciate the time that he takes to explain the procedure to me. He’s patient and helps me to feel comfortable asking questions. ... his office is one of the most beautiful buildings I’ve been in.”

testimonials.author: David Peterson
testimonials.testimonial: “As a fellow orthodontist I can’t speak more highly of Dr Hansen and his wife Amy. Dr. Hansen is passionate, honest, and very detail oriented. ... He is an incredible orthodontist that you can trust to create your dream smile.”

testimonials.author: Hannah Minall
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Hansen was absolutely fantastic! While traveling from out of town, we had an unexpected orthodontic emergency with my teen, and he went above and beyond to help us. ... I highly recommend Dr. Hansen for exceptional care!”

Enjoying time together

image.alt: Bright, welcoming Hansen Orthodontics reception area with smiling staff and modern decor

paragraphs.text: To deliver transformative orthodontic and aesthetic care through innovation, expertise, and an unwavering commitment to excellence. Your journey to a radiant, confident smile starts with us.

At Hansen Orthodontics & Aesthetics we design personalized treatment plans that align with each patient’s lifestyle, goals, and long‑term dental health, centering the experience on comfort, trust, and precision.
We use modern technology and gentle techniques to make treatment efficient and comfortable, offering options such as braces and clear aligners when appropriate.
Our team focuses on clear communication, flexible scheduling, and building relationships so every patient feels supported from their first visit through long‑term care.

items.name: Amy Whitesides
items.bio: Amy leads our brand, culture, and patient experience. Bilingual in Spanish and English, she holds a degree in Communications (Public Relations) from Utah Valley University and brings nearly a decade of dental and orthodontic experience. Amy oversees in‑house marketing, patient messaging, and office culture; she is a mother of two who enjoys reading, Latin dance, and country music.

image.alt: Bright, welcoming orthodontic office reception and team

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first appointment is a comprehensive orthodontic evaluation where you will meet our team, tour the office, and receive a full exam using advanced digital technology. We use an intraoral scanner and high-resolution photos instead of traditional molds when appropriate, so we can create a clear, personalized treatment plan and show you example results for braces, clear aligners, and airway-focused care.

During the consultation we will review X-rays and diagnostic scans, discuss recommended treatment options, estimated timeline, and costs, and answer any questions. Typical exam items include an oral and facial evaluation, digital imaging (intraoral scan, photos, and CBCT when indicated), a clear discussion of options and finances, and time with the treatment coordinator. Please bring photo ID, your insurance card if you have coverage, a list of medications and medical history, and any referral or prior imaging if available.

image.alt: Modern orthodontic exam room with digital imaging equipment

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible monthly payment plans with low or no interest and extended terms to reduce monthly costs. Third-party financing is available through trusted medical lenders to help make treatment more affordable.

We verify benefits with all insurance providers and will file claims to maximize coverage and reduce out-of-pocket cost. Complimentary consultations are available; book your free consultation on the Contact page.

Most new patient paperwork and intake is handled online. Use our secure patient portal to complete forms and manage your account, or request an appointment through our contact form if you prefer to schedule directly. We did not find downloadable PDF intake packets on the site; please use the portal or contact page for new patient intake.

image.alt: Patient completing new patient forms on a tablet in a bright office
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Get Started | Hansen Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Learn what to expect at your first visit, how to complete new patient forms, and how financing and insurance work at Hansen Orthodontics.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We recommend an initial orthodontic evaluation around age seven to spot developing issues and determine the right timing for care. Early interceptive treatment aims to guide jaw growth and make later treatment simpler and less invasive.
An exam by about age 7 lets us identify emerging problems while growth can still be guided effectively, often avoiding more complex treatments later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Common interceptive approaches include palatal expanders to widen narrow arches, space maintainers after early tooth loss, limited braces or aligners on select teeth, habit‑correction appliances, and growth‑guidance devices to improve jaw relationships.

image.alt: Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Early care can correct jaw misalignment before it worsens, guide the eruption of adult teeth, reduce the likelihood of extractions or surgery later, and often result in shorter, less complex treatment during the teenage years.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention
Smiling family enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Adult orthodontics delivers comfortable, effective options that fit modern lifestyles. With healthy gums and bone, teeth can move at any age and contemporary systems often shorten treatment while improving aesthetics.
Teeth respond to orthodontic forces regardless of age, provided periodontal health is good. Care focuses on predictable movement, comfort, and minimizing disruption to your routine.

image.alt: Adult patient receiving orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: We offer clear aligners including Spark and Invisalign, ceramic tooth‑colored brackets, and low‑profile self‑ligating systems for a discreet look without sacrificing effectiveness.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligner

paragraphs.text: Care begins with a comprehensive evaluation and digital imaging, then we create a personalized plan, monitor progress through regular visits, and finish with retainers and long‑term maintenance.

image.alt: Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology
Adult patient receiving orthodontic treatment

paragraphs.text: Braces remain a reliable way to correct a wide range of alignment and bite concerns. Modern materials and techniques make treatment more comfortable and often more efficient than in the past.

Brackets are bonded to teeth and connected with an archwire that applies gentle, continuous force to move teeth into position. Ceramic brackets operate the same way while blending with tooth color for improved aesthetics.

image.alt: Dental Checkup with Braces

paragraphs.text: Overall treatment time varies with case complexity, commonly between 12 and 36 months; some newer systems can reduce friction and in certain cases shorten the timeline.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Expect an initial bonding appointment, periodic adjustment visits, guidance for oral hygiene, possible mild soreness after adjustments, and a final removal followed by retainer care to maintain results.

image.alt: Smiling Woman with Clear Aligner
Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners use a series of removable, thermoformed trays to move teeth incrementally. They are planned digitally and typically worn 20 to 22 hours per day with regular monitoring.

Many teens and adults with crowding, spacing, or mild to moderate bite concerns are candidates, though complex surgical cases may require braces or combined care. Aligners offer discreet, removable, and often comfortable treatment.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Orthognathic surgery is considered for significant skeletal jaw discrepancies that cannot be corrected with braces or aligners alone. Early diagnosis helps determine whether growth modification or surgical care will be necessary.

Treatment is coordinated closely with oral and maxillofacial surgeons and typically includes pre‑surgical orthodontics to align the teeth, the surgical procedure to reposition the jaws, and post‑surgical orthodontics for final detailing and retention.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: Retention is vital to preserve your new smile. We provide removable clear retainers, traditional Hawley retainers, and fixed lingual retainers depending on your needs and the long‑term plan.
Typically we recommend full‑time wear for the first few months, then transition to nighttime wear. Many providers advise some form of lifelong nighttime retention to maintain results.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Clean retainers daily with lukewarm water and a gentle brush, avoid hot water and harsh chemicals, store them safely, replace if damaged, and attend regular checkups to keep your results stable.

image.alt: Close-up of retainers
Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: We use modern digital tools to improve precision, comfort, and predictability. Digital scanning, CBCT imaging, 3D printing, and integrated digital workflows make treatment planning and appliance fabrication faster and more accurate.
Fast, radiation‑free intraoral scans capture precise 3‑D images to create accurate records, improve case communication, and speed aligner fabrication.

image.alt: iTero digital scanner in use during orthodontic consultation

paragraphs.text: High‑resolution digital radiography provides detailed imagery with substantially less radiation than film, improving diagnostics while enhancing safety and comfort.

image.alt: Digital X-ray equipment showing detailed orthodontic imaging

paragraphs.text: Advanced software simulates each stage of tooth movement so we can preview results and refine the plan before treatment begins, reducing remakes and improving fit.

image.alt: 3D treatment planning software showing orthodontic simulation
Modern dentist office interior with advanced technology
Enjoying time together

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common patient questions about treatment options, appointment scheduling, and payment and insurance at Hansen Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What treatment options do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer braces (including Damon self‑ligating systems), Spark clear aligners, interceptive / Phase‑1 treatment for children, appliance‑based options (expanders, retainers, mouthguards), and non‑surgical aesthetic procedures such as laser gum contouring and tongue‑tie / lip‑tie release. See explanations of Damon braces, clear aligners, Phase‑1 treatment, gummy‑smile treatment, and tongue‑tie release for details.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: How do I decide between braces and clear aligners?

paragraphs.text: The right option depends on your case complexity, preferred aesthetics, and lifestyle. Spark clear aligners are a discreet removable option for many mild–moderate cases; Damon braces are well suited to complex corrections and can reduce appointment frequency. For help choosing, patients are evaluated with digital imaging and a personalized plan is proposed at consultation.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

accordion.header: What financial and insurance support do you offer?

paragraphs.text: The practice offers flexible monthly payment plans (including low/no interest), extended terms, third‑party financing partners, and support working with insurance providers to maximize benefits and reduce out‑of‑pocket costs. If you have insurance, bring your insurance information to the first visit so staff can review your benefits.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

accordion.header: How do I schedule an appointment, and is a referral required?

paragraphs.text: No referral is required. Patients can contact the office directly or use the appointment request/contact form on the Contact page to request consultations or repairs.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: What should I know about discomfort, emergencies, and daily care?

paragraphs.text: Mild soreness after adjustments is common. For issues such as poking wires, loose brackets, or swelling, use recommended home steps like orthodontic wax, over‑the‑counter pain relievers, and warm salt rinses, and contact the office to schedule a prompt repair. For daily care: brush after every meal, floss daily with threaders or picks, clean aligners with mild soap and lukewarm water, remove aligners for eating, avoid sticky or hard foods, store aligners in their case, and wear retainers as instructed after treatment.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together
Enjoying time together
